templates.value:
The pattern analysis of the weekly chart presents an interesting picture. On the monthly chart, index remains steeply [[if(WholeJSON.del_index<0){underbought} else{overbought}]] and evidently prone to consolidation. [[if(WholeJSON.del_index<0){[[DecIndex]]} else{[[IncIndex]]}]] According to current market value, stocks in the portfolio are at the valuation of [[currency(WholeJSON.acc_value,'GBP')]]. Comparing it with average purchase value, portfolio has made [[if(WholeJSON.del_index<0){loss}else{profit}]] of [[currency(abs(round(absDiff(WholeJSON.acc_value,WholeJSON.prev_value),3)),'GBP')]] and made absolute return of [[abs(round(percentageChange(WholeJSON.acc_value,WholeJSON.prev_value),3))]]%. Overall portfolio has made [[if(WholeJSON.del_pf>WholeJSON.del_index){strong gain}elseif(WholeJSON.del_pf<WholeJSON.del_index){heavy loss}else{moderate}]] of [[round(absDiff(WholeJSON.del_pf,WholeJSON.del_index),3)]] points as against benchmark index FTSE. [[if(WholeJSON.del_pf<0){[[ContriLoss]]}else{[[ContriProfit]]}]] According to our predictions, FTSE index is likely to go [[if(WholeJSON.ftse<WholeJSON.pred_index){up}else{down}]] in near future hitting value of [[currency(round(WholeJSON.pred_index,3),'GBP')]].

[[StockPortfolio]]

The FTSE has ended with nearly bullish pattern reaching to the resistance points on the weekly chart averaging for 6 months. That said, contrary to what was expected, the markets ended up putting up a very strong show. The headline index of [[currency(round(WholeJSON.ftse,3),'GBP')]]  piled up strong loss and ended the week with a net loss of [[abs(round(WholeJSON.del_index,3))]] points on a weekly basis.

The FTSE has observed nearly bearish pattern reaching to the lower circuit points on the weekly chart averaging for 6 months.That said, contrary to what was expected, the markets ended up putting up a weak show.The headline index of [[currency(round(WholeJSON.ftse,3),'GBP')]] piled up strong loss and ended the week with a net loss of [[abs(round(WholeJSON.del_index,3))]] points on a monthly basis.

In general, portfolio shares of [[map(filter(WholeJSON.stocks,x->(round(x.contri,7) <= LossContri)),x -> x.sector)]] companies such as [[map(filter(WholeJSON.stocks,x->(round(x.contri,7) <= LossContri)),x -> x.company)]], has pulled down the valuations by [[abs(round(LossContri,3))*100]]%.

In general, portfolio shares of [[map(filter(WholeJSON.stocks,x->(round(x.contri,7) >= Procontri)),x -> x.sector)]] companies such as [[map(filter(WholeJSON.stocks,x->(round(x.contri,7) >= Procontri)),x -> x.company)]], has pulled up the valuations by [[abs(round(Procontri,3))*100]]%.

#define RunAllFunds(funds)

Your fund [[funds.symbol]]([[funds.company]]), which was originally purchased at [[currency(funds.pprice,'GBP')]] per share, is currently valued at [[currency(funds.fund,'GBP')]].[[if(funds.perc>0){[[if(WholeJSON.del_index>0){[[if(WholeJSON.del_index>funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making profit, your fund is performing below the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index<funds.perc){Both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making profit.Also,there are good signs as your fund is performing above the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index==funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making profit, your fund is performing at just the benchmark set by FTSE}]]}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index<0){[[if(WholeJSON.del_index>funds.perc){Although the FTSE index is making loss ([[WholeJSON.del_index]])and your fund is making profit([[funds.perc]]), your fund is performing below the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index<funds.perc){The FTSE index is making loss ([[WholeJSON.del_index]])and your fund is making profit([[funds.perc]]). There is even better news as your fund is performing above the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index==funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) is making a loss and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) is making profit, your fund is performing at just the benchmark set by FTSE}]]}]]}elseif(funds.perc<0){[[if(WholeJSON.del_index>0){[[if(WholeJSON.del_index>funds.perc){The FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) is making profit and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making loss. This not not tell the whole story as your fund is performing below the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index<funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) is making profit and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) is making loss. This is interesting as your fund is performing above the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index==funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) is making profit and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) is making loss , your fund is performing at just the benchmark set by FTSe}]]}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index<0){[[if(WholeJSON.del_index>funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making loss, there are more worrying signs as your fund is performing below the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index<funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making loss, your fund is performing above the benchmark}elseif(WholeJSON.del_index==funds.perc){Although both the FTSE index ([[WholeJSON.del_index]]) and your fund ([[funds.perc]]) are making loss, your fund is performing at just the benchmark set by FTSE}]] }]]}]]. This fund is making [[funds.contri*100]]% contribution to the general portfolio.Following analysis of the market using our algorithms and projections,[[if((funds.pprice<funds.cprice)&&(funds.fund<funds.cprice) &&(funds.fund<funds.pprice)){we predict the new price will be less than the current and purchased price, hence you can sell off these funds (since your already recording profit on this fund) . However you could hold it if you still have hope in this company}elseif((funds.pprice<funds.cprice)&&(funds.fund<funds.cprice) &&(funds.fund>funds.pprice)){we predict the new price will be less than the current price but higher than the purchased price, hence you can sell this stock (since your already recording profit on this fund) .However, you could hold it for the better earnings in the future}elseif((funds.pprice<funds.cprice)&&(funds.fund>funds.cprice) &&(funds.fund>funds.pprice)){we predict the new price will be greater than both the current and purchased price, hence you can hold this stock (since your already recording profit on this fund). You can also buy more stocks to improve your profits}elseif((funds.pprice>funds.cprice)&&(funds.fund<funds.cprice) &&(funds.fund<funds.pprice)){we predict the new price will be less than both the current and purchased price, hence you can sell it (since your already recording loss on this fund). However, you could hold it in anticipation of better results}elseif((funds.pprice>funds.cprice)&&(funds.fund>funds.cprice) &&(funds.fund<funds.pprice)){we predict the new price will be less than the purchased price but higher than the current price, hence you can sell it (since your already recording loss on this fund). However, you can hold it in anticipation of better results}elseif((funds.pprice>funds.cprice)&&(funds.fund>funds.cprice) &&(funds.fund>funds.pprice)){we predict the new price will be greater than both the purchased and current price, hence you can hold this fund (since your already recording loss on this fund). However you can buy more to increase your earnings}]].
